body.p: You can create your own markup table by exporting an existing markup table in external SGML format, modifying it with any text editor, and importing it back into under a different name. Markup tables need to be available in an SGML-based format to be imported into . Notice that an exported markup table contains only the nondefault entries.
To become familiar with the content of markup tables you might want to export a markup table and study it before you create a new markup table. See for details.

When you have exported one of the markup tables provided by you might see a second tag in the second line <SEGMENTEXIT>userexit</SEGMENTEXIT>. userexit is the name of the dynamic-link library (DLL) containing the user exit code. This tag is only required if a user exit is to be used. For more information, refer to .
